data.content:
Personally, I think this app is a cynical attempt to get money from lonely people. You can't get anyone to even respond, let alone go on a date. Quite often people will unmatch you at exactly the point at which you suggest a date. And, on top of this, it's killing offline dating too! Less people go out to meet other people cause they're all supposedly at home doing it on tinder. 

Regarding the app itself, it's a bit buggy and there are the same old people on it again and again. Overall it feels more like work than anything fun or enjoyable. Most guys just select yes to every woman and see who bites - if it has to work this way why not have an option so men can say yes to all of Tinder and only women get to choose? I think it's horrible either way, I really do, it's a cynical app.

data.content:
1. There needs to be an added "swipe according to filter" option where users can specify, hair colour, height essentially only matching with people of their type.

2. Add what you're looking for (privately in profile) so you only match with other people searching for that, i.e. Love fun etc

3. As a must, I really think based on how frequently you're liked by others, you gain a higher rating (not visible) which means you're just naturally paired with other attractive people, for too long I'm just constantly swiping left. I know it's condoning vanity but you should employ this strategy (leagues essentially) haha.

I think these should all be optional additions in which users can switch on or off in their profile so you can still swipe for fun, but if you wanna search specifically green eyes, black hair etc, then you can.

Shamefully paid for a month of this, not impressed.
